byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt, Matt Apuzzo and Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and ADAM GOLDMAN

abstract: Documents show FBI questioned Hillary Clinton at length about her judgment as secretary of state in using her private email system to discuss classified drone strikes and in permitting aides to destroy many emails, before deciding not to bring criminal charges; use of private server has dogged her campaign for 18 months.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton was questioned about her use of a private email system to discuss drone strikes and allowing aides to destroy correspondence.
snippet: Mrs. Clinton was questioned about her use of a private email system to discuss drone strikes and allowing aides to destroy correspondence....

headline.main: F.B.I. Papers Offer Closer Look at Hillary Clinton Email Inquiry
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Files on Email Inquiry Show Grilling on Clinton’s Judgment
